intro: Microblepharis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its highly variable leaf shapes, which can range from filamentous to broad and lobed, depending on environmental conditions. The plant is typically found in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. It possesses specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing small aquatic organisms. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
